channel.title: Norwegian Institute for Urban and Regional Research

summary.en: Land ownership is historically linked to brute power in Colombia. The 3.5 million internally displaced people (IPD) of today have lost about 1 million hectares of land. This paper argues restitution will be very costly, but it might be necessary to avoid impunity to prevent similar land confiscations in future.

title.en: Compensation or restitution of land rights in the Colombian peacemaking process â€“ Economic effiency vs. society building?

publisher.name: Norwegian Institute for Urban and Regional Research
